data.title: Destinations of Sarawak - Borneo,Malaysia
data.meta_description: Sarawak is a state on the wild island of Borneo, a refuge for rare and exotic species of wildlife and home to a melting-pot of religions and ethnic groups, each with its own language, cuisine and culture. The island is known for its majestic highlands, jungle and endangered orangutans, and world-class scuba diving. Sarawak for its longhouses, rivers and winding waterways, rainforests, bazaars, temples, museums and mosques. History and culture meet at the Sarawak Cultural Village, on the outskirts of Kuching, a living museum of local tribes and architecture, nestled into the foothills of Mount Santubong.
data.text:
Kuching is the capital of the state of Sarawak and a gateway to the steaming jungles of Borneo, for travellers coming from mainland Malaysia. The town is well situated for visitors to make day excursions to the coast or to the tropical rain forests. The newly renovated 1ACS Residence is situated in the centre of the town and is a well-managed Christian hotel, aligned to the ecumenical member churches of Malaysia whose mission is to provide clean, safe and comfortable accommodation to tourists and visitors.

Location: 93350 Kuching
